class_notes:
Course Topic: An Age of Transition: 1830 ~ 1900


This course aims to inform students of not only major figures in Victorian literature
but also the nineteenth-century cultural context where concepts of gender, class, race, and
sexuality underwent dramatic changes along with technological innovations, social reforms, and imperial expansion. Major writers include (but are not limited to) John Stuart Mill, Elizabeth Barrett Browning, Alfred Tennyson, Robert Browning, John Ruskin, Charles Dickens, Matthew Arnold, Charlotte BrontÃ«, Elizabeth Gaskell, Dante Gabriel Rossetti, Charles Darwin, Christina Rossetti, Robert Louis Stevenson, Walter Pater, Michael Field (Katharine Bradley and Edith Cooper), and Oscar Wilde.
course_description: Representative works from the Victorian period, including poets such as Tennyson, the Brownings, and the Rossettis, and prose writers such as Carlyle, Mill, Ruskin, and Cobbe.
